channel.title: Having trouble understanding PlayerSE's
channel.description: Ok I was trying to figure out how to make someone continuously do an emote while walking, and the drunktimer in cheezscape really looked like what I was looking for. I just don't understand how it specifies the emote to use. I recognised how it finds the correct emotes for some weapons to create the correct output, but I still dont get how it combines then to create the output. I know the emote number for the drunk emote, but I do not see it in that area. now I do recognise the 0x(number) from some of my experience in other things, and I'm sure the emote number is in one of those things form that form, but I have no idea how to convert a number in to that form. IF someone could help me understand how this works, I could do some really cool things, any help here?

item.title: Having trouble understanding PlayerSE's
item.dc:creator: @Blood_Argon Blood_Argon
item.description:
@Blood_Argon wrote:

Well, this may be a little sketchy to follow, but…
Make a new public int,

public int drunktimer = false

Now, make something in the public boolean process, for this…

if (drunktimer = true) { <<InsertActionHere>> }else{ }

Read full topic

item.title: Having trouble understanding PlayerSE's
item.dc:creator: @yppman yppman
item.description:
@yppman wrote:

Ok I was trying to figure out how to make someone continuously
do an emote while walking, and the drunktimer in cheezscape really
looked like what I was looking for. I just don’t understand how it
specifies the emote to use. I recognised how it finds the correct
emotes for some weapons to create the correct output, but I
still dont get how it combines then to create the output. I know
the emote number for the drunk emote, but I do not see it in
that area. now I do recognise the 0x(number) from some of my
experience in other things, and I’m sure the emote number is in
one of those things form that form, but I have no idea how to
convert a number in to that form. IF someone could help me
understand how this works, I could do some really cool things,
any help here?

Read full topic
